definition: to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation

sentences.english: My French has got rather rusty.
I leave uncultivated today, was preciselyyesterdayperishestomorrow which person of the body implored.
sentences.chinese: 我荒疏的今日，恰是昨日殒身之人祈求的明日。

sentences.english: My French has got rather rusty .
sentences.chinese: 我的法语有几分荒疏了。

sentences.english: I'm out of practice on the piano because I am so busy.
sentences.chinese: 我太忙了，所以荒疏了钢琴练习。

sentences.english: Your English has got rusty ; you must brush it up.
sentences.chinese: 你的英语已经荒疏了，必须重新学过。

sentences.english: My French is a bit rusty .
He used to be good at cricket, but now be's out of practice .
sentences.chinese: 他过去擅长于打板球，可现在已荒疏了。

sentences.english: Dust off your old skills and prepare for new responsibilities.
sentences.chinese: 把你荒疏已久的技艺重新练好，准备担负新任务。

definition: to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
not paying attention to anything (idiom); to idle time away
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
